Ask HN: Why is it so hard to search for art?
text:
I'm trying to find a piece of art to hang on the wall and I imagine there is quite a lot of art out there that fits the query. Specifically, I'm looking for a painting or design in modern style that has a lot of white with some yellow accents and includes a feminine figure, something like this [0]. But it has been tremendously difficult to find anything coming close to this description. What do you use to search for art?

Show HN: A tool to find books outside gender echo chambers
text:
Hi HN. I made this mostly for my own curiosity. Many of us end up reading books by or about people of specific genders. So it's interesting to find books that are outside that echo chamber but still mostly _inside_ the topical or affinity area we are most engaged in. Doing this, it helps us to each expand our reading while elevating underrepresented authors, topics and character-types in the books we read.

For myself, I found it most interesting to find more female writers in the topic area of economics and technology, where I've experienced a high concentration of male writers.

From the explainer: . Imagine sitting in a library of limited size, tailored perfectly to your tastes. If we look at all the books in this library, the genders of their authors, and the genders of characters within the books, then we can find your "literary gender bias". That's what this tool attempts to do. Giving the tool 3-5 books can serve as the seeds of this hypothetical library. From these, we can then extrapolate, calculate and show you your gender bias, and a set of recommendations that seek to invert that bias.

title: Ask HN: What is the closest option to a Fairphone available in the US?
text:
I would like a Fairphone but the countries they ship to are limited [1] Is there a US company making something similarly hackable/serviceable and that is designed to run Lineage/e/Calyx? Or better, ships with that preinstalled? The size of the phone does not matter to me.

Bonus feature for me would be if there was an open source engineering firmware available that provided full control and visibility into the baseband chips and exposed more cell site data. I had phones with the engineering firmware when I was in wireless ages ago and it was super useful.

[1] - https://support.fairphone.com/hc/en-us/articles/202005103

Ask HN: Has Mark's Google account been reinstated yet?
text: Just over a month ago, the New York Times reported that a man named Mark had his Google account terminated because its AI accused him of possession of child porn. Even after police confirmed that the accusation was completely false, Google still didn't give him back his account. <https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=32538805> Now, over a month later, has he made any headway yet?

Ask HN: How to Fairly Share Equity?
text:
I'm a freelancer and started to develop a prototype in my spare time which already caused a lot of time and energy. As everyone I think it also has a nice market fit and with some work I should be able to develop a full product and find a few customers. Though, I am not a sales guy and I think someone with sales expertise would definitely help to push it forward. Hence, I got in touch with another small company and they suggested that I (including the prototype) join their company as CTO. The company offers consulting in the same area and consists mainly of one freelancer who engages other freelancers depending on the projects. I know him from previous business and some of the freelancers as well so they are not complete strangers. I suggested to found a new company to clearly separate it from the previous work but they stated that it would be too much effort.

Now I am a bit unsure how to approach the situation: - should I insist to found a new company? how would you split the equity in that case? is there any best practice? - what would you demand in case I would decide to join as CTO? Equity? Since it's already an established company it has a certain value but the value is actually only based on the current/previous consulting gigs which makes it kind of difficult. Also, I don't know what happened in the past and do not know if the company has any liabilities. - if I join them, how can I "protect" the code so they cannot simply fire me afterwards and take it for them? how can I ensure that I can still use the code afterwards? - is the code really worth anything at the moment?

Thanks for your insights!

Ask HN: Does your Apple Silicon MacBook still report a lot of disk read/writes?
text:
This was a discussion when M1 macbooks were launched, and Apple supposedly addressed it in an OS update.

It still seems pretty high to me. Yeah, I'm aware that SSD lifespans are long and TBW is pretty high. Compared to my linux machines, this seems extraordinarily high.

Currently on my newish M1 MBA, with the latest updates, with barely any use, 98%+ sleep, I'm seeing about:

2.8GB/day reads 2.0GB/day writes

Here's the latest report from smartctl

---------------------------------------------------- SMART/Health Information (NVMe Log 0x02) Critical Warning: 0x00 Temperature: 27 Celsius Available Spare: 100% Available Spare Threshold: 99% Percentage Used: 0% Data Units Read: 706,839 [361 GB] Data Units Written: 610,056 [312 GB] Host Read Commands: 9,006,950 Host Write Commands: 6,722,232 Controller Busy Time: 0 Power Cycles: 95 Power On Hours: 5 Unsafe Shutdowns: 11 Media and Data Integrity Errors: 0 Error Information Log Entries: 0 ----------------------------------------------------
